result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley M. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To have a mental health assessment.  Comply with all recommendations DOC may impose.  To attend a 12 step program.  Once released to make sure she cleans the house.  All conditions DOC may impoe.  DOC to prioritize services need to reduce the overall risk by identifing the mental health issues.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley M. Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ashley M. Smith in court with attorney James C McLaughlin.  Defendant Ashley M. Smith in custody.   Tom Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 13 CM 178 for sentencing after revocation.  State makes stmt.  J.O. addressed the Court/defendant.  B.O. addressed the the defendant/court.  State argues sentencing - 8 months jail with 123 days credit time served - probation 1 year.  Atty McL argues sentencing.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  13 CM 178:  8 months county jail with credit for 123 days time served  with good time - costs - huber for work search/work/child care/ assessments as long as she can satisfy the sheriff's departments rules etc.

14 CF 22:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs - restitution $500.00 Mr. and Mrs. Otto- consecutive to 13 CM 178 - undergo AODA subtance abusive eval. - mental health assessment - prioritize service to reduce the overall risk by identifing the mental health issues - to comply with all recommendations DOC may impose - to attend a 12 step program - clean house one discharged from jail - prohibited from having any pets - all conditions DOC may impose.
Sentencing hearing on June 20, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant, Ashley M. Smith appeared with Attorney James C McLaughlin.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances.  Court reviews plea questionaire and waiver of rights. Court questions Ms. Smith. Court finds that Ms. Smith freely and kwowningly waives her rights and that there is a factual basis. State offers a motion and moves to amend to a misd theft. Court accepts motion.  Ms. Smith pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds Ms. Smith guilty. 
Also has 13CM178 with sentence at that time as well. Ms. Smith remains in the custody of the sheriff.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on May 9, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Ashley M. Smith in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Ashley M. Smith in custody.  Thomas Henry Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Mr. Frost speaks to the court. Mr. McLaughin speaks to the court and objects to the procedure. Court finds based upon the police report that is attached that there is probable cause to believe that the def. committed a crime and is boundover for a trial. Court also finds that the booking photo is the defendant. Objections from Mr. McLaughin are noted. Back on record at 11:53. Information received. Waived reading. Def pleads not guilty. Subsitution March 28th, Defense motions May 2nd.  Bail will continue.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ashley M. Smith in court with attorney James F. McLaughlin.  Defendant Ashley M. Smith in custody.  Thomas H. Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty McL waived reading
Court bail will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Not to have any contact with Sather Jewlery Store or B.O.
